skills.name: Calculate the square of a number

explanations.A: 1 squared = 1 x 1 = 1. This is also an odd number, so the answer is 1
explanations.B: Not quite. 3 is odd but it isn't a square number. Remember we get square numbers by multiplying 2 copies of the same number together
explanations.C: Not quite. 4 is square, but it isn't an odd number
explanations.D: Almost. 9 is an odd square number, but is there a smaller one?

explanations.A: Not quite. 1 is a square number but it isn't even
explanations.B: Not quite. 2 is even but it isn't a square number. Remember we get square numbers by multiplying 2 copies of the same number together
explanations.C: 2 squared = 2 x 2 = 4. This is also an even number, so the answer is 4
explanations.D: Not quite. 9 is a square number but it is not even.

explanations.A: Not quite, the 2 is a power. It tells us how many copies of the large number we have to multiply together, not what number to add on
explanations.B: Not quite, the 2 is a power. It tells us how many copies of the large number we have to multiply together, we don't just multiply the big number by the power
explanations.C: The small 2 means squared, and it tells us we have to multiply 2 copies of 53 together.
explanations.D: Not quite, the 2 is a power. It tells us how many copies of the large number we have to multiply together

explanations.A: Not quite, the 2 is a power. It tells us how many copies of the large number we have to multiply together, not what number to divide by
explanations.B: The small 2 means squared, and it tells us we have to multiply 2 copies of 47 together.
explanations.C: Not quite, the 2 is a power. It tells us how many copies of the large number we have to multiply together, not what number to add on
explanations.D: Not quite, the 2 is a power. It tells us how many copies of the large number we have to multiply together, we don't just multiply the big number by the power

explanations.A: Not quite. You have just placed 2 copies of 9 next to each other rather than multiplying them
explanations.C: Not quite. I think you have multiplied 9 by 2, rather than multiplying 2 copies of 9
explanations.D: Not quite. I think you have multiplied 9 by 2 squared. We just need to multiply two copies of 9 together

explanations.A: Not quite. I think you have multiplied 5 by 2, rather than multiplying 2 copies of 5
explanations.B: Not quite. I think you have multiplied 5 by 2 squared. We just need to multiply two copies of 5 together
explanations.D: Not quite. You have just placed 2 copies of 5 next to each other rather than multiplying them

explanations.A: Not quite. I think you have multiplied 7 by 2, rather than multiplying 2 copies of 7
explanations.B: Not quite, the 2 is a power. You can't just bring it down to write it as an integer. We need to multiply 2 copies of 7 together
explanations.C: Not quite. You have just placed 2 copies of 7 next to each other rather than multiplying them

explanations.A: Not quite. I think you have multiplied 9 by 2, rather than multiplying 2 copies of 9
explanations.C: Not quite, the 2 is a power. You can't just bring it down to write it as an integer. We need to multiply 2 copies of 9 together
explanations.D: Not quite. You have just placed 2 copies of 9 next to each other rather than multiplying them

explanations.B: Not quite. I think you have multiplied by 2, rather than multiplying 2 copies of 1000 together
explanations.C: Not quite. You have multiplied by 10 rather than multiplying 2 copies of 1000 together
explanations.D: Not quite. You have placed the 2 on the end of the number but it is a power. It tells us we need to multiply two copies of 1000 together

explanations.A: Almost. Just check that you have done 1000 x 1000
explanations.B: Not quite. I think you have multiplied by 2, rather than multiplying 2 copies of 1000 together
explanations.C: Not quite. You have placed two copies of 1000 next to each other, but you need to multiply them
